intro: Rubus adscitus var. franconius, commonly known as the Franconian blackberry, is a variant of the common bramble. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. This variety is valued for its edible berries and its role in ecological habitats.
